Player History
Released by Penn on 1/31/1976...
Signed as a free agent by Minnesota on 2/9/1976 to a 2-year deal worth $14,000,000 per year...
Had first career hit on 4/3/1976, off Kevin Bugarin (WIS)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/3/1976, off Timothy Mixson (PIT)...
Won Outstanding Newcomer Award in 1976, hitting .268 with 15 HR, 80 RBI...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Second Base in 1976...
Drove in 6 runs against Bay City on 7/24/1977...
Drove in 6 runs against Bay City on 6/19/1978...
Won World Championship with Minnesota in 1979...
Injured on 7/8/1980 with a Ruptured Elbow Ligament, out for 8 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by Halifax on 2/10/1981 to a 5-year deal worth $4,428,000 per year...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Pontiac on 9/13/1981...
Injured on 4/13/1984 with a Strained Rib Cage Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
